intro: Jurinea capusii, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean and is adapted to sandy, saline environments. The plant features silver-gray foliage and striking blue or violet composite flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dune habitats. Jurinea capusii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in stabilizing coastal dunes.
